title: Opportunity-Zone Funds Are Off to a Slow Start, Lagging Behind Heady Expectations
text:
Investors have been slow to embrace a new tax break meant to spur economic growth in distressed communities, leaving the amount of money raised for these programs well short of fund managers’ lofty expectations.

The program, part of the 2017 federal tax overhaul, allows investors to defer and reduce taxes if they reinvest capital gains in nearly 9,000 low-income communities designated by the federal government as opportunity zones.
